verses.verse: I <S%H589><s%> am the <S%H2261>rose<s%> of <S%H8289>Sharon,<s%> and the <S%H7799>lily<s%> of the <S%H6010>valleys.<s%>

As the apple <S%H8598>tree<s%> among the <S%H6086>trees<s%> of the <S%H3293>wood,<s%> <S%H3651>so<s%> is my <S%H1730>beloved<s%> <S%H996>among<s%> the <S%H1121>sons.<s%> I sat <S%H3427>down<s%> under his <S%H6738>shadow<s%> with great <S%H2530>delight,<s%> and his <S%H6529>fruit<s%> was <S%H4966>sweet<s%> to my <S%H2441>taste.<s%>
He <S%H935>brought<s%> me <S%H413>to<s%> the <S%H3196>banqueting<s%> <S%H1004>house,<s%> and his <S%H1714>banner<s%> <S%H5921>over<s%> me was <S%H160>love.<s%>
Stay <S%H5564><s%> me with <S%H809>flagons,<s%> <S%H7502>comfort<s%> me with <S%H8598>apples:<s%> <S%H3588>for<s%> <S%H589>I<s%> am <S%H2470>sick<s%> of <S%H160>love.<s%>
His left <S%H8040>hand<s%> is <S%H8478>under<s%> my <S%H7218>head,<s%> and his right <S%H3225>hand<s%> doth <S%H2263>embrace<s%> me.

I <S%H7650>charge<s%> you, O ye <S%H1323>daughters<s%> of <S%H3389>Jerusalem,<s%> by the <S%H6643>roes,<s%> <S%H176>and<s%> by the <S%H355>hinds<s%> of the <S%H7704>field,<s%> that ye stir not <S%H518>up,<s%> <S%H5782><s%> <S%H518>nor<s%> <S%H5782>awake<s%> <S%H853><s%> my <S%H160>love,<s%> till he <S%H7945>please.<s%> <S%H2654><s%>

My <S%H1730>beloved<s%> is <S%H1819>like<s%> a <S%H6643>roe<s%> <S%H176>or<s%> a <S%H6082>young<s%> <S%H354>hart:<s%> <S%H2009>behold,<s%> <S%H2088>he<s%> <S%H5975>standeth<s%> <S%H310>behind<s%> our <S%H3796>wall,<s%> he looketh <S%H7688>forth<s%> <S%H4480>at<s%> the <S%H2474>windows,<s%> showing <S%H6692>himself<s%> <S%H4480>through<s%> the <S%H2762>lattice.<s%>
My <S%H1730>beloved<s%> <S%H6030>spoke,<s%> and <S%H559>said<s%> unto me, Rise <S%H6965>up,<s%> my <S%H7474>love,<s%> my fair <S%H3303>one,<s%> and come <S%H1980>away.<s%>
For, <S%H3588><s%> <S%H2009>lo,<s%> the <S%H5638>winter<s%> is <S%H5674>past,<s%> the <S%H1653>rain<s%> is <S%H2498>over<s%> and <S%H1980>gone;<s%>

The <S%H5339>flowers<s%> <S%H7200>appear<s%> on the <S%H776>earth;<s%> the <S%H6256>time<s%> of the <S%H2158>singing<s%> of birds is <S%H5060>come,<s%> and the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of the <S%H8449>turtle<s%> is <S%H8085>heard<s%> in our <S%H776>land;<s%>

The fig <S%H8384>tree<s%> putteth <S%H2590>forth<s%> her green <S%H6291>figs,<s%> and the <S%H1612>vines<s%> with the tender <S%H5563>grape<s%> <S%H5414>give<s%> a good <S%H7381>smell.<s%> <S%H6965>Arise,<s%> my <S%H7474>love,<s%> my fair <S%H3303>one,<s%> and come <S%H1980>away.<s%>

O my <S%H3123>dove,<s%> that art in the <S%H2288>clefts<s%> of the <S%H5553>rock,<s%> in the <S%H5643>secret<s%> places of the <S%H4095>stairs,<s%> let me <S%H7200>see<s%> <S%H853><s%> thy <S%H4758>countenance,<s%> let me <S%H8085>hear<s%> <S%H853><s%> thy <S%H6963>voice;<s%> <S%H3588>for<s%> <S%H6156>sweet<s%> is thy <S%H6963>voice,<s%> and thy <S%H4758>countenance<s%> is <S%H5000>comely.<s%>
Take <S%H270><s%> us the <S%H7776>foxes,<s%> the <S%H6996>little<s%> <S%H7776>foxes,<s%> that <S%H2254>spoil<s%> the <S%H3754>vines:<s%> for our <S%H3754>vines<s%> have tender <S%H5563>grapes.<s%>
My <S%H1730>beloved<s%> is mine, and <S%H589>I<s%> am his: he <S%H7462>feedeth<s%> among the <S%H7799>lilies.<s%>

Until <S%H5704><s%> the <S%H7945>day<s%> <S%H3117><s%> <S%H6315>break,<s%> and the <S%H6752>shadows<s%> flee <S%H5127>away,<s%> <S%H5437>turn,<s%> my <S%H1730>beloved,<s%> and be thou <S%H1819>like<s%> a <S%H6643>roe<s%> <S%H176>or<s%> a <S%H6082>young<s%> <S%H354>hart<s%> <S%H5921>upon<s%> the <S%H2022>mountains<s%> of <S%H1336>Bether.<s%>
